subject: Re: Parameterized test does not play well with Eclipse TestRunner UI
msgSnippet: This is a JUnit issue as well. I have the same issue with JExample: if a test has parameters, you can rerun a single test, but not browse it. Why does this

This is a JUnit issue as well. I have the same issue with JExample: if a te=
st has parameters, you can rerun a single test, but not browse it.

Why doe=
s this happen? The plugin works with the org.junit.runner.Description that =
it gets from JUnit. Such a description contains a mere string rather 
than =
a reference to a java method, thus the plugin must guess about the strings =
format when trying to locate the method for browsing. Rerunning 
should wor=
k fine, since that happens by matching description strings against each oth=
er.

cheers,
AA

ccess/failure, eclipse will complain with "Can't find method

thodName[0]' opening test class instead".
